name: Array
description: `Iterate.Array` works in many ways similar to field-components. It has a value-property that can receive an array or you can give it a path if you want it to retrieve an array from a surrounding DataContext. All children components of Iterate.Array are rendered once per item the array-value consists of.

props.name: value
props.doc: The data to iterate over. Alternative you can use the `path` prop.

props.name: path
props.doc: A path (JSON Pointer) to the array to iterate over.

props.name: itemPath
props.doc: A path (JSON Pointer) to nested array items.

props.name: required
props.doc: If the array is required. It does not automatically inherit the `required` property in the same way that `Field.*` components do. You may provide a custom error message to give the user a more useful message than the default one: `errorMessages={{ 'Field.errorRequired': 'Custom message' }}`

props.name: minItems
props.doc: The minimum amount of items required to iterate over.

props.name: maxItems
props.doc: The maximum amount of items to iterate over before showing the error.

props.name: limit
props.doc: Limit the number of rendered items to iterate over. Defaults to `undefined`.

props.name: reverse
props.doc: When `true` it will reverse the order of the items.

props.name: countPath
props.doc: A path (JSON Pointer) to the array length.

props.name: countPathTransform
props.doc: Will transform the current value before it is displayed.

props.name: countPathLimit
props.doc: Will limit the iterate amount by given "countPathLimit" value.

props.name: withoutFlex
props.doc: When `true` it will omit the Flex.Stack wrapper so it can be used for tables and lists.

props.name: animate
props.doc: When `true` it will animate the height of the items.

props.name: placeholder
props.doc: Will be shown if the value or data context value is empty.

props.name: emptyValue
props.doc: Will be used to compare the value in order to show the placeholder.

props.name: containerMode
props.doc: Defines the container mode for all nested containers. Can be `view`, `edit` or `auto`. When using `auto`, it will automatically open if there is an error in the container. When a new item is added, the item before it will change to `view` mode, if it had no validation errors. Defaults to `auto`.

props.name: onChangeValidator
props.doc: Custom validator function where you can return `undefined`, `Error`, `FormError` or an Array with either several other validators or several `Error` or `FormError`. It is triggered on every change done by the user. The function can be either asynchronous or synchronous. The first parameter is the value, and the second parameter returns an object containing { errorMessages, connectWithPath, validators }.

props.name: validateInitially
props.doc: Set to `true` to show validation based errors initially (from given value-prop or source data) before the user interacts with the field.

props.name: validateContinuously
props.doc: Set to `true` to show validation based errors continuously while writing, not just when blurring the field.

props.name: children
props.doc: React.Node or a function so you can get the current value as the first function parameter, and the index as the second parameter as well as the array of internal items as the third parameter.

events.name: onChange
events.doc: Will be called when a value of a field was changed by the user, with the data set (including the changed value) as argument.
